intro: Leptochilus salicinus, commonly known as the slender-leaved watercress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in moist, aquatic or semi-aquatic environments. The plant has alternate, narrow, and linear leaves that are often submerged or floating. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in clusters, typical of the mustard family. It is often found in streams, ditches, and wet meadows, contributing to aquatic ecosystems.
